author: Carol Simon

review: Easy to install - zero thought, all you do is plug it in, switch the TVs HDMI input to the one you connected the Fire TV to and enter your wireless LAN password. It really is that simple.If you like watch free video that isn't YouTube trash, get this and a Prime Membership or a Netflix Membership, or both. It streams flawlessly from all the major services and really is HD in picture and sound quality. I've also used Roku and have to say, much as Roku is good, Fire TV is way better.The remote is wonderfully simple (like Roku's but perhaps a little more rational in its flow) and the voice search works perfectly (and I have a voice that is generally very hard for voice recognition software to deal with). I typically use voice now to find things instead of typing, though I must confess that I have not yet searched for Gary Busey ...

review: We had cancelled our live content about 10 months ago with our satellite provider, and have been using Netflix only for 1.5 years.  Now with Amazon fire, we added Prime and Hulu, wow there is a lot to choose from.  We are a family of 3 with a 13 yr old and we all find something of interest, including family shows we can all agree on.The *only* thing that I see as lacking is a feature for different user profiles, similar to Netflix.  Everyone has to skip through each others shows or movies to see your own in each respective view or queue.

review: ==The Good==* You can watch amazon prime, netflix, and many other streaming videos* You can buy plenty of digital movies on amazon* You can play some games, and I hope this gets better over time==The Bad and not so good==* NO USB - sorry, if you have a huge collection of digital movies, they won't play on this device* The game collection is pretty limited* Less than 5 GB of usable space, and many games over 1 GB... with no option of external storage! Does anyone see a problem here?? Why bother selling a game controller for a system that can only hold 2-3 real games? Even my freken cell phone can store more than this thing!* The search thing only works with Amazon apps and videos. Not netflix or anything else.If you have amazon prime and like buying digital videos from amazon, and don't give a hoot about gaming, this is a solid buy.If you want to get access to all of your video content + streaming from netflix, get a WDTV.... at least until external usb storage is available.
author: Ice cream samarai salami

review: I purchased the box the day it was released.  I recently became a "cable-cutter" and needed a box to replace my first generation Roku.  My main reason I went with the Fire TV vs. a Roku 3 was the promise of Free Time coming "next month."  Well, it's now nearly June, and no Free Time for the Fire TV. Now you go out to the Amazon Fire TV Free Time section of their website and it says Free Time is "Coming Soon."  So does that mean June, July, The First of Octember (it's a Dr Seuss book)?  I sent an e-mail asking about what "premium" content that would be offered for $2.99 a month (Disney, Nick Jr.?) - They can't say was their response. So it appears Free Time is a no-go.  I am also somewhat disappointed about the limited voice search only directing you to Amazon Content.  There has been comments from Amazon that this will eventually be "fixed" but no update yet.  In my humble opinion, it was released too soon.  The software is half-baked at best.  They should have perhaps held out for a summer release (July) with all the features that were promised.
